SectionBody.Text: As provided in the common law, in criminal prosecutions after the closing of evidence:

Subsection.Text: The prosecuting attorney shall open the closing arguments.
The accused or the attorney for the accused may reply.
The prosecuting attorney may reply in rebuttal.

SectionBody.Text: The method set forth in this section shall control unless the Supreme Court determines it is procedural and issues a substitute rule of criminal procedure.
